Description: Terracotta oil-lamp with two nozzles. Round body with depressed ring on top with central cone, presumably the base of a lost knob; a hole to either side of knob; on underside three incised circles and within "ATIME" in raised relief; much broken on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Local version of Italian 'facts' lamp end 1st c AD, copied in Egypt and other parts of the Empire (Bailey 1988, Egypt Q1962 Gaul Q1592-3). Parallels from Ehnasya were dated 3rd century AD or earlier (Petrie 1904, 7, M20, M22, M24, M28).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.35) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5880 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
